summary: Elizabeth C Feeley was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). She is mentioned in several payroll and certification reports spanning from December 1977 to March 1979. These documents list her name, position, and salary during her time with the committee. The consistent appearance of her name across multiple payroll certifications indicates her sustained employment with the HSCA during the period covered by the documents.
significance: Elizabeth C Feeley's significance lies in her role as an employee of the HSCA, contributing to the committee's investigation into the JFK assassination. While the specific nature of her work is not detailed in these documents, her presence on the payroll indicates her involvement in the administrative or investigative functions of the committee.
